isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-6613 SERIES - REMOVE - AUXILIARY HOUSING ASSEMBLY

figure.caption: Figure 36. Auxiliary Housing Assembly Exploded View

step1.para: Remove the four bolts and the cover from the intermediate shift cylinder ( Figure 37).

figure.caption: Figure 37. Remove Bolts and Cover From Intermediate Shift Cylinder

step1.para: Remove the locknut from the shaft in the cylinder ( Figure 38).
Pull evenly to the rear and remove the cylinder housing from the bore in the auxiliary housing TLNK XREFid="f1303039">Figure 39).
Remove the piston from the cylinder housing and, if necessary, remove the O-ring from the outer diameter of the piston ( Figure 40).

figure.caption: Figure 40. Remove Piston From Cylinder Housing

step1.para: If necessary, remove the O-rings from the bore and gasket from the shaft ( Figure 41).

figure.caption: Figure 41. Remove O-Rings From Bore and Gasket From Shaft

step1.para: Remove the bolts and the two rear countershaft bearing covers ( Figure 42).

figure.caption: Figure 42. Remove Bolts and Rear Countershaft Bearing Covers

step1.para: Remove the snap ring from the rear of both countershafts ( Figure 43).

figure.caption: Figure 43. Remove Snap Ring From Rear of Countershafts

step1.para: Remove the 19 bolts which attach the rear housing to the intermediate case ( Figure 44). Re-insert one bolt near both dowel pin locations and turn in just far enough to catch two or three threads.

figure.caption: Figure 44. Remove Bolts Attaching Rear Housing to Intermediate Case

step1.para: Insert three puller bolts and move the rear housing approximately 1/4 inch to the rear ( Figure 45).

figure.caption: Figure 45. Insert Puller Bolts and Move Rear Housing to Rear 1/4 Inch

step1.para: Insert flat stock, such as flat-bladed screwdrivers, between the auxiliary and intermediate housings ( Figure 46).

figure.caption: Figure 46. Insert Flat Stock Between Auxiliary and Intermediate Housings

step1.para: Use a soft bar and maul against the rear of both countershafts to move them as far forward as possible ( Figure 47). This will move the bearings to the rear on the shafts.

figure.caption: Figure 47. Move Countershafts as Far Forward as Possible

step1.para: Remove the screwdrivers and back out the 3 puller bolts. Drive the rear housing forward to its original position against the intermediate housing. This will expose the 2 rear bearing snap rings ( Figure 48).

figure.caption: Figure 48. Remove Screwdrivers and Back Out Puller Bolts

step1.para: Attach a bearing puller to each snap ring and remove both rear bearings from the countershafts ( Figure 49).

figure.caption: Figure 49. Remove Rear Bearings From Countershafts

step1.para: Remove the puller bolts. Attach a chain hoist to the rear housing and move the assembly straight to the rear and away from the intermediate housing, taking care not to damage the oil trough located at the top rear of the intermediate housing ( Figure 50). Mount the assembly in a vise in the upright position.

figure.caption: Figure 50. Move Assembly to Rear and Away From Intermediate Housing
